cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 280 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Mississippi/Alabama border area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi–Alabama coast close to the mouth of the Pearl River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch west of Shell Beach LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island AL to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Mouth of the Pearl River MS to the Alabama-Florida border; Tropical-storm warning west of Pearl River to east of Morgan City LA and eastward to the Okaloosa-Walton County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible in outer rainbands; tropical-storm-force winds very unlikely at the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Tampa Bay / Port Manatee with present track
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief squally bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain as Gordon passes well to the west
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and elevated wave heights in the approaches to the port; small-craft operating restrictions probable
